result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L. Bula was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
First 50% must be in jail, second 50% could be on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and RISK Assessment. 
Huber for employment or any counseling she may be involved in.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Letter of apology to Shopko within 30 days. 
Not be on the premises of Shopko in Stevens Point. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.

timeConds.notes:
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and RISK Assessment. 
Huber for employment or any counseling she may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca L. Bula

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca L. Bula in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:53 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Drengler does agree with the prior conviction for repeater status. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Imposed/Stayed 9 months jail
First 50% must be in jail, second 50% could be on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and RISK Assessment. 
Huber for employment or any counseling she may be involved in. 
Placed on probation for 12 months: 
Serve 30 days jail.  
7 days credit.
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and RISK Assessment. 
Huber for employment or any counseling she may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
Pay restitution of $180.93 to Shopko. 
Letter of apology to Shopko within 30 days. 
Not be on the premises of Shopko in Stevens Point. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rebecca L. Bula appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/ng entered.
bond continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Not be on the premises of Shopko in Plover or Stevens Point.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Theft.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  12/14/2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
